image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken to a dozen families who say their sons have been subjected to, or groomed to inflict, violent punishments in an alleged decades-old cycle of torment at the Victorian boarding school.

title.children: Parents hire lawyers over alleged abuse at prestigious Ballarat Grammar

image.altText: A dimly lit pokies room with bright colourful lights coming from each of the machines.

props.synopsis: The social cost of gambling in Victoria, such as bankruptcy, loss of productivity at work, mental ill-health, and divorce, has reached $14 billion, a new study has found.

title.children: 'Horribly normalised addiction': Gambling harm in Victoria reaches $14b

image.altText: An image of graffiti at Princes Park

props.synopsis: Carlton's training base and former home ground is vandalised, as the Blues take stock following a 50-point loss to Port Adelaide on Thursday night.

title.children: Carlton's spiritual home vandalised as Blues slump to 50-point loss

image.altText: A woman with a 7 News microphone in front of her face.

props.synopsis: The judge in Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial has told jurors they will not begin deliberations until next week.

title.children: Erin Patterson jury deliberations to begin next week, judge tells court

image.altText: A koala sitting among gum leaves.

props.synopsis: A group has launched court action after aerial culling was undertaken to end the suffering of about 1,0000 starving or burnt koalas affected by bushfire in Victoria.

title.children: Wildlife advocates file lawsuit over mass koala shootings

image.altText: A midddle-aged man in a cap and work shirt stands near a large shed as chickens wander around in a yard.

props.synopsis: A Victorian poultry farmer details the emotional toll of an avian influenza outbreak on his properties. The business is expected to return to full production this year, but biosecurity concerns remain.

title.children: Farmer recovering after culling 500,000 chickens amid bird flu outbreak

image.altText: Firefighters battle a factory fire in the early hours of the morning.

props.synopsis: Firefighters have battled two factory fires across Melbourne overnight, with at least a dozen crews called to one of the fires in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Police investigating suspicious factory fires across Melbourne

image.altText: A female doctor carrying a stethoscope.

props.synopsis: Medical students say a rural work program meant to solve doctor shortages is pushing some to abandon their careers and others to pay their way out of the scheme.

title.children: Medical graduates question rural relocation work scheme

image.altText: aerial image of police car at scene of alleged assault in wheatsheaf

props.synopsis: A former Australian Army reservist who murdered his neighbour by throwing petrol on him and lighting him on fire will be in his 90s by the time he is eligible for parole.

title.children: 'Sad, angry' man jailed for 35 years after lighting neighbour on fire

image.altText: A man with a black jacket and a walker stands next to a woman in a black jumper and a walker

props.synopsis: A not-for-profit organisation says increasing administrative costs linked to the federal government's aged care reforms have left it with no choice but to stop providing transport to social outings for residents.

title.children: Aged care reforms leave elderly cut off from social outings

image.altText: Young woman smiling in front of green bush. She has long red hair and is wearing a pink puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: While a growing number of Australians are moving away from organised religion, some people like Samantha Raabe are bucking the trend and finding a new faith later in life.

title.children: Finding religion later in life defies national trend

image.altText: A view of farmland taken from a rocky outcrop in western Victoria.

props.synopsis: Western Victoria will host one of the world's largest rare earth mines after Astron Corporation's Donald Project receives final approval by the Victorian government, as farmers in the area express dismay.

title.children: Donald Project gets green light from Victorian government

image.altText: A man, smiling, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: A jury finds a man who stabbed a young Melbourne doctor 11 times after a home invasion guilty of murder.

title.children: Jury finds man guilty of murdering doctor Ashley Gordon

image.altText: A group of Carlton and Brisbane players gather in a pack, with a Blues player in the air as rain tumbles down during a game.

props.synopsis: Unless you're playing at Docklands, weather is always a feature of games of AFL. Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson take a look at how teams adapt to different conditions, who plays better in the wet, and the growing issue of scheduling and heat.

title.children: How Australian Rules football adapts to the weather, and who's best in the wet

image.altText: Vegetable workers in horticulture farm

props.synopsis: Workplace law breaches are rampant in prime horticulture zones in Victoria and NSW, the ombudsman reports, with labour hire firms the worst culprits and migrant workers most affected.

title.children: Scathing report finds horticulture workers treated 'very badly'

image.altText: Parents and children holding a sign at a rally.

props.synopsis: Dozens of community members are rallying against a council decision that could put a beloved not-for-profit childcare centre in Melbourne's inner west at risk of closing.

title.children: AFL club says end of not-for-profit childcare status will lower fees

image.altText: BK 2 Basics charity founder Kelly Warren with her husband Craig.

props.synopsis: A food relief centre in Melbourne's south-east that helps feed 7,000 people a week is being pushed to the brink as it tries to meet strict council rules.

title.children: Popular Melbourne food bank facing closure as demand surges

image.altText: A person holds a mobile phone in their hand with the screen open to a digital licence with driver's photograph.

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity specialists warn a "very cheap coding trick" is being spruiked as a high-tech anti-fraud measure on digital drivers licences.

title.children: Digital drivers licence anti-fraud technology only a 'cheap coding trick'

image.altText: A woman embraces a group of people outside court

props.synopsis: On Wednesday, the Federal Court ruled that Antoinette Lattouf was unlawfully terminated by the ABC in December 2023. This is what we know about what will happen next.

title.children: Why the Lattouf v ABC legal saga isn't over yet

image.altText: A man and woman stand grouped in a selfie with their two young children, one girl and one boy, all smiling.

props.synopsis: Celebrities like Miley Cyrus are speaking about the benefits of eye movement desensitisation and reprocessing (EMDR) therapy. But what is EMDR and its role in psychological treatment?

title.children: When Samuel's mum died, he didn't expect EMDR to be his 'circuit breaker'

image.altText: Photos of three authors and their books pictured against a brown paper background

props.synopsis: ABC experts unpack the shortlist of Australia's biggest book prize: who made it, who missed out and who they think will win.

title.children: Why this year's Miles Franklin shortlist is the most 'radical' yet

image.altText: laughing woman stands in snow up to her knees.

props.synopsis: A fresh dump of snow has blanketed Victoria's major alpine resorts, providing one of the best starts to the ski season in years.

title.children: 'Magical' start to ski season as fresh snow blankets resorts

image.altText: A young woman looking confused, starting at her phone while sitting at a desk

props.synopsis: Superannuation can seem like a set-and-forget prospect. But how often should you be checking your account and what should you be looking for?

title.children: Why it is important to check your super account regularly

image.altText: Gold Coast Suns coach Damien Hardwick holds up his middle finger in the coach's box during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: Gold Coast coach Damien Hardwick has been fined for directing a middle finger towards AFL umpires late in the Suns' loss to GWS on the weekend.

title.children: AFL's 'Year of the Bird' continues as Hardwick fined for flipping off umpire

image.altText: A young girl with red hair tucked into bed, lying on her side and blowing her nose.

props.synopsis: Winter can be a contagious time of year for everything from COVID-19 to the common cold, but there are ways to limit the risk of illnesses spreading from one family member or housemate to another.

title.children: What you can do to stop the spread of illness in your home

image.altText: A man wearing a black singlet walking through a media pack.

props.synopsis: John Torney's negligent manslaughter case is further delayed after his mother and brother escape a fire that destroyed their home days before appearing in court.

title.children: Manslaughter hearing delayed after key witnesses escape fire

image.altText: Artist impression of a big pear with sign calling Shepparton the nation's food bowl.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Goulburn Valley is known as the food bowl of Australia, but it could soon be known as the home of the giant pear in a bid to attract tourists to the regional centre.

title.children: Proposal to build $1.3m giant pear in Shepparton to celebrate history

image.altText: Bull dog Hank sitting on the grass, with green dense bushes behind him and the sun shining in the sky.

props.synopsis: Hank the Tank is believed to have spent 30 days lost in chilly, dense Victorian bushland before making his way back home.

title.children: Beloved pet bulldog survives month lost in Gippsland bush

image.altText: A basin at a low level of water

props.synopsis: In a bid to conserve water, authorities across the state have been forced to move to very unusual winter restrictions.

title.children: Winter water restrictions turned on for three Victorian regions

image.altText: gas fitter carries out service on gas water heater in Perth backyard

props.synopsis: From 2027, old gas hot water systems will be replaced with electric ones in homes under new reforms aimed at tackling emissions and gas shortages.

title.children: Gas is on the way out as Victoria continues push for all-electric homes

image.altText: British and Irish Lions' Sione Tuipulotu running with the rugby ball in two hands during a match

props.synopsis: Born in Victoria and growing up surrounded by Australian Rules, Sione Tuipulotu's rise to the British and Irish Lions follows hard work, perseverance, and the willingness to take a chance.

title.children: From Frankston to Scotland, Sione is plotting the Wallabies' downfall

image.altText: a sign of Ballarat Grammar school

props.synopsis: A prestigious regional Victorian independent school has launched its third investigation in five months into allegations of "serious misconduct" in its boys' boarding houses.

title.children: Ballarat Grammar launches third investigation into boys' boarding houses

image.altText: A man and a woman in their seventies since on a bench in their garden amongst flowers.

props.synopsis: Mick Tomkins is one of many Victorian power station workers suffering from asbestos-related cancers and the only remaining support group is calling for more funding to stay active.

title.children: Calls for help as power workers continue to die from asbestos exposure

image.altText: A man and a woman in their seventies since on a bench in their garden amongst flowers.

props.synopsis: Mick Tomkins is one of many Victorian power station workers suffering from asbestos-related cancers and the only remaining support group is calling for more funding to stay active.

title.children: Calls for help as power workers continue to die from asbestos exposure

image.altText: A man in suit and tie standing in front of a wooden wall

props.synopsis: The head of a local government advocacy organisation is in court this week for an intervention order hearing over allegations of harassment.

title.children: Council Watch head fights mayor's bid for intervention order
